author: cornl
title: Cardano Center Poland stage 2 - SPO
description: Cardano Community Hubs like Cardano Center Poland should become self-sufficient at possibly early stage for continuous independent growth.

f6_assessments.q0: The idea is great, Hubs need to find a way of becoming sustainable, a great challenge that many Catalyst communities face constantly. The proposal does address the challenge required points and will bring value to Cardano´s ecosystem by giving Poland a sustainable and reliable space to connect.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal has a clear view of the tasks which needs to be done, provides a detailed list of them and a clear timeline. 
On the other side I´m concerned on the level of competition against Pools in the space, the proposal addresses this problem saying they did a market analysis, I would like more information about that and maybe a little more  detailed on how to promotion strategy would work. The marketing is done by the team? Do you need to hire a community manager for "content creation and publications"? I think the proposal would benefit for a clearer breakdown on Marketing Costs.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal provides several channels for the proposal to be audit and timeline is reasonably achievable. 
About "growing the numbers on Cardano Center Poland social media and exploring contacts with other blockchain communities.", I think the proposal would benefit for clear Outcomes KPIs, like a clear expectation on community growth, like X amount of Telegram Users or Stakers, followers, traffic. Also from how this approach to Blockchain communities would work. 
*The 2 million active stake, is aimed at the 6 month mark?
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback and suggestions.

f6_assessments.q0: Building on their earlier funded proposal (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/381137) that focused on web presence, the Cardano Center Poland is now aiming to become financially self-sustaining by initiating stakepool operations. Initially, 2M+ ADA sounds like an ambitious goal for a new stakepool. However, with the reach that they already have combined with planned marketing efforts, this is very much an attainable goal. In fact, with 40 million people living in Poland and another 20 million people with Polish ancestry worldwide, this can ultimately become a very large hub and stakepool.
f6_assessments.q1:
Having already attracted more than 1,100 members in their network, the Cardano Center Poland is well on its way of doing just that: becoming self-sustaining. With a budget as low as $5,280 this is in line with the Minimum Viable Hubs concept introduced by the challenge team. Even when combined with their other proposal regarding the live events (https://cardano.ideascale.com/c/idea/399413/) the total budget remains well below the 5% of the total fund allocation ($25K). This investment makes sense if it can reduce the need to apply for further Catalyst funding in coming Funds.

The plan is not only to cover the expenses of initiating stakepool operations from a technical standpoint but a lion’s share of the budget is reserved for marketing costs, to bring in more people into the hub and into the stakepool. This shows that the team’s focus is a balanced development of the hub as a whole.

As 30% of the budget is earmarked to a “Linux Specialist who is willing to play a part in this project”, it would have been good to disclose the identity of the said individual or at least share some of the credentials if they prefer to remain anonymous. Apart from that there is nothing much more to improve in this well thought-out and somewhat simple plan. The team has proven themselves and since they are somewhat public figures in the Polish Catalyst scene, it is likely that they deliver exactly what they promise.

Current unpredictable geopolitical situation has been taken into account and, to be on the safe side, the servers will not be located in Poland. Virtual Private Servers should guarantee 100% uptime.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal is clear and the set goals are very realistic. The team aims for an ambitious delivery schedule, promising that the Stake Pool will be up and running after two weeks of being funded. First block should be produced within 2 months and total financial independence should be reached within 6 months. These projections are reasonable.

Stakepool operations can naturally be tracked with any publicly available tools and the marketing activities will show up (in Polish) in Telegram, Discord, their website and through their partners’ channels. Hence, this is clearly an auditable proposal and there is nothing much to improve. The provided information is convincing and sufficient.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback and suggestions.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is well written and is addressing the gap between the two half of the Europe (West and East) in terms of pool operators. My opinion is that the proposal doesn't fit well into the Challenge brief as a staking pool is not addressing (generally speaking) the new comers and it has few things in common with a Hub creation. This is why my rating is 3.
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is outlined clearly and broken down into identifiable items and seems reasonable to achieve the set goals.
Based on the references presented it seems that the proposer and the other team member have the necessary experience and skills to successfully implement this proposal.
The proposal provides a sensible and conductible plan for implementation that shows not only what is being done but also how and the proposer has considered challenges and risks relevant to a successful implementation.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal is well written and gives the impression that the team knows well what they have to do to successfully implement this proposal.
The metrics and KPIs were well chosen and I believe they are good indicators for evaluating success, as the chosen outputs would clearly indicate the number of delegated ADA and the progression over time.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback and suggestions. I respect your comment regarding Alignment yet in our opinion this proposal doesn't fit anywhere else and is used actually to scale-up our community hub.

f6_assessments.q0: Cardano Community Hubs is an important direction for the global Cardano development. Taking to account my experience in multiple funds, I feel that Europe and Eastern Europe (so Poland as important country in it) is underrepresented. So other geographies, like Africa, Latin America, East Asia have bigger attention and funding, but not Europe. That’s one of the reasons why I think this proposal should be supported. Another reason is that after launching and maintaning high-quality Stake Pool, Cardano Center Poland can become self-contained from external funding. So this might be 1 time Catalyst funding and then we’ll see the self-sufficient development of Cardano Center in Poland.
f6_assessments.q1: The team is experienced and known in the Cardano community. Moreover Kornel Gajewski is Cardano ambassador. Launching Stake Pool within one-two weeks is a good plan and the overall roadmap is very detailed and clear. A detailed budget breakdown looks fine too, the overall cost is modest comparing to many other proposals in this category. The only thing to add, I can suggest is to have a calculation of possible revenues from the stake pool. For example how much you will get with XXX number or delegation, how much with YYY and how these profits will help to cover the activities of Cardano Center Poland. Maybe the funds from stake pool rewards won’t be enough, so then your Center can provide other activities, i.e. consulting, or running sidechains, etc.
f6_assessments.q2: Operable Stake Pool ~2 weeks after Fund 8 completion is an achievable goal which will be easy to audit and check. Actually all the results will be easy to check, by visiting the pages the proposer provided. However it would be harder to achieve 2M+ staked ADA. It’s not so easy now for the new stake pools to find delegators. Maybe you could add how you think you will get this number. Maybe Polish communities are active among ADA holders and will support, maybe you have your own funds or funds of business partners, friends, etc.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback and suggestions.

f6_assessments.q0: The proposal is aligned with the challenge especially on that fact it will want to be sustainable. With ongoing activities of the Poland communities the proposal is looking at creativity and direct use of cardano products to build the hub. This inherent marketing strategy is highly welcome
f6_assessments.q1:
The budget is very reasonable detailing how the funds will be used. Though the project seems huge more than the budget but the planned activities are carefully thought out administer the funding for success. 

The  team looks committed and willing to deliver for the project much knowledge stake pool, thereby creating a unique cardano hub in Poland. 

The timeline for sustainability of the hub carefully thought of and looks a core thing the proposal is focusing to achieve
f6_assessments.q2: The deliverables are are clear with measurable KPIs. This is well thought of with indicators that are realistic and making evaluation easier
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your feedback and suggestions.

f6_assessments.q0: Yes, it is in line with the challenge brief of ensuring resilience and self-reliance within that community. The project is about launching, maintaining Stake Pool and making it self-contained from external funding.
f6_assessments.q1: Based on the team’s credentials provided the project is very likely to be implemented successfully. The timeline and deliverables are simple to understand and looks achievable. Budget breakdown of the fund of $5,280 requested seems feasible based some researched information provided by the proposer, which is relatively a small budget request.
f6_assessments.q2: The metrics and KPIs are clear and measurable. Their presence in several social platforms is easy to access by voters and satisfies the brief of projects transparency. The proposer has highlighted the 3 potential risks as a stumbling block and has provided solutions to mitigate 2 of them, however, the third being the crucial one considering this project is for launching and maintaining Stake Pool, lack of active stake is a serious risk to the challenge objective of Hubs becoming self-contained from external funding. Some questions for the proposer to consider are how will they deal with this? Will the team return for more funding, or will the team continue to self-fund? Maybe the proposer can provide some comments below to help provide transparency for the voters on this topic.
f6_assessments.reply: Thank you for your review and suggestions. Regarding the auditability part, of course self-sufficiency is the goal of this proposal so that we wouldn't need to return to Catalyst for new funding directly aimed at running Hub (and hopefully we will come with our Community members to help them kickstart their future ideas :-) )

solution: The proposal focuses on launching and maintaning high-quality Stake Pool to make Cardano Center Poland self-contained from external funding.
experience:
Kornel Gajewski - 4-yr-experienced blockchain translator & BeInCrypto.pl writer/editor; Cardano Ambassador
Nikodem Zegzda - podcaster, YouTuber, entrepreneur, organizer of numerous events as a founder of Lideruj.pl
+ pre-contracted Linux Specialist
